identificationModule.briefTitle: Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation Aided Rehabilitation of Gait in Subacute Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to determine if transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS)applied over the lower extremity motor cortex in conjunction with treadmill training is effective for improving gait in patients with subacute stroke and to evaluate the effect and predictive value of a single session of anodal tDCS.

armGroups.label: anodal tDCS with treadmill training
armGroups.description: Each subject will receive 4 weeks gait treadmill training at least 3 days per week in combination with anodal transcranial Direct Current Stimulation over the primary motor cortex up to 20 min

interventions.name: Transcranial Direct Current Stimulation
interventions.description: A direct current runs between two electrode positions and affects the excitability of the underlying brain tissue

primaryOutcomes.measure: Maximal gait speed using the 10-m walking test
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and follow up immediately following the 4 weeks intervention

secondaryOutcomes.description: We will measure cortical excitability using single pulse transcranial magnetic stimulation (TMS) before and after 1st stimulation session. We will compare the measurements from before stimulation to after stimulation.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Dynamometry: the maximal isometric force of muscles will be assessed by Biodex System 3 PRO dynamometer
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Baseline and immediately following the 4 weeks intervention

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Age ≥ 18 years
* Onset of stroke less than 14 days
* First ischemic stroke causing lower limb weakness (MRC score ≤4 in knee extensors) and gait impairment

Exclusion Criteria:

* Contraindications to MRI or TMS
* Other neurological disorders
* Significant somatic or psychiatric disorders
* History of seizures
* Language or cognitive disorders prohibiting participation
